Description: Rim and body sherd with handle root of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: on rim, dilute lines between black bands; wall glazed; top of rim glazed; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with band between; wall glazed and handle root. Inscription on inside of rim.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burnt during the bombings in London in 1941. Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the rim and body find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C. These cups are both amongst the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villiard's Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.075) (Phase 3)
